intro: Anagosperma dispermum, commonly known as the two-seeded bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its specialized structures called bladders, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms for nutrition. The plant produces two seeds per capsule, a trait reflected in its scientific name. It typically grows in freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches, where it can anchor itself to submerged surfaces. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on carnivorous plant adaptations and ecological interactions.
